SLiCAP referenceÂ¶

SLiCAP is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International License. Based on a work at: http://www.analog-electronics.eu/slicap/slicap.html

SLiCAP comprises the following modules:

SLiCAP

Spyder Editor

SLiCAPinstruction

SLiCAP instruction class definition.

SLiCAPexecute

SLiCAP module with functions for execution of instructions.

SLiCAPyacc

SLiCAP netlist parser: functions for converting a netlist into a circuit object.

SLiCAPhtml

SLiCAP module with HTML functions.

SLiCAPplots

SLiCAP module with plot functions.

SLiCAPpythonMaxima

SLiCAP module with symbolic math functions executed by maxima CAS.

SLiCAPmatrices

SLiCAP module for building the MNA matrix and the associated vectors.

SLiCAPprotos

SLiCAP module with basic SLiCAP classes and functions.

SLiCAPmath

SLiCAP module with extended matrix class and SLiCAP math functions.

SLiCAPlex

SLiCAP tokenizer for netlist files.

SLiCAPini

SLiCAP initialization module, imports external modules and defines settings.

SLiCAPconfig

SLiCAP module with user-defined path settings.

For operating SLiCAP from within Jupyter lab or Jupyter notebook the main module to be imported is:

  • SLiCAPnotebook.py

This module imports the other modules listed on top of this page and defines variables and functions for displaying math, rst and .svg files in notebooks.
